page.title: 17Religion in Canterbury (1)
page.content:
Canterbury has a rich heritage of religious associations dating back to beyond the time of St.Augustine in the sixth century A.D.
Not only the{Cathedral}but also the many{churches}which flourish in the city bear witness to the{Christian} significance of the City.Many of the older churches are to be found within the original flint walls of the Mediaeval City but others are to be found at historically important sites within the city and forming an integral part of its environment.
All the major{denominations}can be found in the City. A special council, the Canterbury Christian Council, is helping to bring nearer the day when Christians everywhere will join in united worship.
